meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a vulture in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The vulturish bird circled high above, searching for its next meal.
meanings.sent2: The sky was filled with vulturish creatures, their sharp eyes scanning the ground below.
meanings.sent3: The vulturish vulture eyed the picnic blanket with keen interest.
meanings.sent4: Her vulturish gaze seemed to strip away any pretense, leaving only raw truth behind.
meanings.sent5: The vulturish silhouette against the sunset was a haunting sight.

meanings.definition: Showing a predatory or scavenging nature.
meanings.sent1: The vulturish cat prowled the alley, looking for scraps of food.
meanings.sent2: His vulturish instincts kicked in as he spotted the vulnerable prey.
meanings.sent3: The vulturish raccoon stealthily approached the trash can, ready to scavenge for leftovers.
meanings.sent4: Her vulturish behavior at the buffet table earned her the nickname 'The Scavenger'.
meanings.sent5: The vulturish way he eyed the last piece of cake made everyone else hesitant to reach for it.

meanings.definition: Describing someone or something as opportunistic or greedy.
meanings.sent1: The vulturish businessman took advantage of the situation to make a profit.
meanings.sent2: Her vulturish nature became evident when she swooped in to claim all the credit.
meanings.sent3: The vulturish behavior of the salesperson trying to upsell unnecessary items was comical.
meanings.sent4: His vulturish tactics in negotiations left his opponents feeling drained and defeated.
meanings.sent5: The vulturish landlord raised the rent without any consideration for his tenants' financial struggles.
